sentence.Network_en: I think Tessa should plump for Malcolm, her long-suffering admirer.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想特莎应该选择长期默默爱慕她的马尔科姆。

sentence.Network_en: He was an admirer of her grandfather's paintings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他非常欣赏她祖父的画作。

sentence.Network_en: He is a great admirer of Picasso's early paintings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他十分赞赏毕加索的早期画作。

entry.def: If you are an admirer of someone, you like and respect them or their work very much.

example.ex: He was an admirer of her grandfather's paintings.
example.tran: 他非常欣赏她祖父的画作。

entry.def: A woman's admirers are the men who are attracted to her.

example.ex: Johnny was the most persistent and most harmless of her admirers.
example.tran: 约翰尼是追她的人中最痴心、最没有心机的一个。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who backs a politician or a team etc.;

sentences.sentence: "all their supporters came out for the game"

means.word_mean: 2. a person who admires; someone who esteems or respects or approves
3. someone who admires a young woman;

auth_sentence.content: I was always an admirer of Dada and Surrealism.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was always an admirer of Dada and Surrealism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was always an admirer of Dada and Surrealism.

auth_sentence.content: But King was a great admirer of the Israeli state.
auth_sentence.res_content: But King was a great admirer of the Israeli state.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But King was a great admirer of the Israeli state.

auth_sentence.content: Today she wears a handmade bracelet sent by an admirer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Today she wears a handmade bracelet sent by an admirer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Today she wears a handmade bracelet sent by an admirer.

sentences.en: There was a little cluster of admirers round the guest speaker.
sentences.cn: 有一小群仰慕者围着那位特邀嘉宾。

sentences.en: Of all her admirers the most permanent was Sir John.
sentences.cn: 在她所有的爱慕者当中，约翰爵士最有恒心。

sentences.en: Her admirers were fewer, and fatter, and less ardent.
sentences.cn: 她的爱慕者少一些, 胖一些, 感情不那么热烈。
